title: Using GradientExplainer on stateful keras LSTM
body:
It seems issue #644 was never resolved, maybe I can provide a different example here. I get an `InvalidArgumentError` on [line 333 of _gradient.py](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/master/shap/explainers/_gradient.py#L333)`

I am training a stateful LSTM model using keras, where the sample size needs to be divisible by the batch size with zero remainder.

```
batch_size = 21
x_test.shape
>>> (2268, 1, 3)  # [n_samples, n_timesteps, n_features]
x_test.shape[0] % batch_size == 0  # needs to be True for stateful LSTM prediction
>>> True
type(model)
>>> tensorflow.python.keras.engine.sequential.Sequential


explainer = shap.GradientExplainer(
    model=model, data=shap.sample(x_test, 100),
    batch_size=batch_size
)
shap_values = explainer.shap_values(x_test)
...
>>>        331                 v = tf.constant(X[i].reshape(shape), dtype=self.model_inputs[i].dtype)
>>>        332                 inputs.append(v)
>>>    --> 333             return out(inputs)
...
>>> InvalidArgumentError: Incompatible shapes: [2268,32] vs. [21,32] [Op:AddV2]
```

So the issue is with data shape. However, the model is working to predict on data if I run it manually

```
model.predict(x_test, batch_size=batch_size)
>>> array([[-0.00056655],
           [-0.00056655],
           [-0.00056655],
           ...,
           [-0.00056655],
           [-0.00056655],
           [-0.00056655]], dtype=float32)
```

Does SHAP support stateful LSTM? If so, how can I change my inputs to run SHAP explainer on a stateful LSTM?

**EDIT:** I tried to fix this using

```
stateful_out = out.predict(X, self.batch_size)
return tf.constant(stateful_out)
```

But then I get the error `AttributeError: 'Function' object has no attribute 'predict'`... which is strange, because if I print ` out.predict(X, self.batch_size)` from the `run()` method, it does actually print the correct numpy array.
